spell.name: Gravecraft
entries: 你可以操纵不死力量，创造以下效果之一：
1. 你可以让你能看到范围内的生物尸体随机抽搐或移动。例如，你可以让尸体的手臂或尾巴挥动。这种移动不足以执行简单任务，与物体互动，或以任何方式伤害生物。
你可以让一个中型或更小尸体或尸体碎片短暂地复活并朝你选择的方向移动5英尺。移动结束后，它会恢复成无生命状态。 (D&D进行中的规则)
3. 你可以修复一个尸体或骷髅上的单个肢解部位，比如手或胳膊，只要它在你的视线范围内。例如，你可以重新连接一只胳膊或修复一个尸体的断骨，前提是必要的身体部位是可用的。
4. 你可以短暂地刺激尸体灵魂的碎片，使其眼睛在5英尺半径内发出微弱的光芒，持续时间最长为1分钟。根据当地的语言习惯，像（%num%）这样的文本在翻译中仍应输出为（%num%）。翻译应符合DND游戏组规则，专有名词在翻译后应在括号中保留英文。
你可以让骨架上任何残留的肉迅速在一分钟内分解。这个过程只留下硬化或漂白的骨头。
6. 你可以让幽灵的低语或声音从尸体中发出。你无法控制这些低语，因为它们是用生前生物所说的语言，并且所说的词语或短语是关于生物生活中某件事的随机短语。它可能是生物一生中任何时刻的人名、物品、地点或时刻。
如果你多次施放这个法术，你可以同时拥有最多三个其1分钟效果的法术，你也可以将这样的效果作为一个动作来解除。(D&D运行小组规则)

spell.name: Soul Blade
entries: 作为施放法术的一部分，你必须使用武器进行近战武器攻击，攻击范围内的一个生物，否则法术失败。命中时，目标承受攻击的正常效果。如果这次攻击使一个生物的生命值降低到0，你获得{@dice 1d8}临时生命值。 (D&D游戏组规则)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries:
在更高的级别时，法术的伤害会随着你达到更高级别而增加。在第5级时，近战攻击对目标造成额外{@damage 1d8}的死灵伤害，并且在将生物的生命值降至0时，你会获得{@dice 2d8}的临时生命值。在第11级和第17级时，这两个数字都会增加{@dice 1d8}。

(dnd)

spell.name: Blade of Decay
entries: 你可以用死灵魔法灌注你的武器，使你的对手的伤口溃烂。作为施放该法术所用动作的一部分，你必须用武器进行一次近战武器攻击，攻击范围内的一个生物，否则法术失败。命中时，目标受到攻击的正常效果。直到你的下一个回合开始前，该生物下一次受到伤害时，会额外受到{@damage 1d6}死灵伤害。 (dnd, necrotic damage)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 在更高的等级上。 当你达到更高的等级时，法术的伤害会增加。 在第五级时，近战攻击对目标造成额外的 {@damage 1d6} 黑暗伤害，并且目标额外受到 {@damage 2d6} 黑暗伤害。 在第11级和第17级时，两个骰子都增加了 {@dice 1d6}。 (Higher Levels)

spell.name: Festering Wounds
entries: 你可以创造一个黑暗的死灵魔法束缚，加剧了被削弱生物的痛苦。这个死灵冲击打击你选择的一个生物，该生物正在患有以下条件之一：{@condition blinded}、{@condition deafened}、{@condition poisoned}或{@condition paralyzed}。死灵触须对其目标造成{@damage 2d8}点死灵伤害。 (dnd running group rules) (necrotic magic) (necromantic tendril)
这种效果会自动失败，法术会被浪费，如果生物没有受到这些条件中的任何一个的影响。 (D&D running group)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 在更高级别时。 当你使用2级或更高级别的法术位施放此法术时，该法术会针对每个高于1级的法术等级额外造成{@damage 1d8}的伤害。 (Higher Levels)

spell.name: Phantom Bolt
entries: 你可以向你的敌人发射一个哀嚎的灵魂。对一名生物进行远程攻击。命中后，目标受到{@damage 2d8}点死灵伤害，并必须进行一次感知豁免。在豁免失败的情况下，该生物将会{@condition frightened}直到其下一回合结束。在效果持续期间，该生物的移动速度将会减半，直到其下一回合结束。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 在更高的等级上，当你使用2级或更高级别的法术槽施放这个法术时，伤害会增加{@dice 1d8}，每个法术槽等级高于1级。

entries: 你可以召唤亡灵之灵来惩罚伤害你的生物。生物必须成功进行一次感知豁免投骰。在未通过的投骰中，该生物会受到 {@damage 2d8} 死灵伤害直到其下一个回合结束。在这种方式下 {@condition frightened}，生物的速度会在持续时间内减半。在成功的豁免投骰中，生物会受到一半的伤害且不受其他影响。{@damage 2d8}、{@condition frightened}和{@condition frightened}这些术语会保持原文括号内的英文。

spell.name: Animate Skeleton
entries: 你可以使用一具具有挑战等级为1或更低、不是构造物、植物或不死生物的尸体，将其复活成为骷髅。在你完成施法后，尸体将以骷髅仆役的形式复活。 (dnd)
在其不死形态下，目标的游戏统计数据保持不变，除了以下内容。该生物不能使用任何类似职业特性、天赋施法、契约魔法、施法、带有充能、传奇行动或原始形态的巢穴行动的特性。 (dnd running group rules)
在此法术持续期间，生物获得以下额外特征：(spell)
这个生物的类型变为不死生物。(Undead)
它获得了对毒素、精神和死灵伤害的免疫。 (Dungeons & Dragons 运行组规则)

7. 如果在那个回合被转动或受到辐射伤害，它将无法从这个特性中受益。 (DND游戏组规则)

你可以决定亡灵在接下来的回合中采取什么行动以及它将移动到哪里，或者你可以发布一个一般性的命令，比如守卫特定的房间或走廊。如果你没有发布任何命令，亡灵只会对敌对生物进行自卫。一旦下达了命令，亡灵将继续遵循直到任务完成。
如果亡灵被杀死，它会完全化为灰烬，彻底毁灭其形态。（DND进行组规则）

spell.name: Animate Zombie

m.text: A corpse of a creature which is consumed with the spell

entries: 你可以将死去不久（1）的挑战等级为1或更低的生物的尸体注入死灵魔法，将其复活为僵尸，前提是该尸体不是构装、植物或不死生物。施法完成后，尸体将作为僵尸仆役复活。在其不死形态下，目标的游戏统计数据保持不变，除非以下情况：不死体无法使用原始形态的职业特性、先天施法、契约魔法、施法、具有重新充能、传奇行动或巢穴行动的能力。
在此法术持续期间，生物获得以下额外特征：(spell)
1.This creature's type is now Undead.
2.Creatures hit by the zombie's melee attacks must succeed a Constitution saving throw equal to your spell DC or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn
3.Creatures {@condition poisoned} by the zombie cannot regain hitpoints for the duration of that effect.
4.The zombie can use its bonus action to move up to its movement speed towards a hostile creature it can see.
5.It gains immunity to poison and necrotic damage.
6.It gains immunity to being {@condition charmed}, exhausted, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}
7.It gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from attacks that are not silvered.
8.It no longer needs to breathe or eat

9.When it is reduced to 0 hitpoints, it can make a Constitution saving throw equal to half the damage dealt (minumum 10) to regain 1 hitpoint instead. It cannot benefit from this feature if it is turned or takes radiant damage on that turn.

The undead is friendly to you and your allies and acts on your initiative after your turn. It obeys your verbal commands as a bonus action as you mentally command any undead you made with this spell within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple undeads, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the undead will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the undead only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the undead continues to follow it until its task is complete.

spell.name: Corpse Burst
entries: With a surge of necromantic energy, you can cause a corpse, or a creature with 0 hitpoints to explode. If the creature has 0 hitpoints, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, that creature instantly dies and explodes. Creatures in a 10ft. radius around that creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw and half as much on a success. A creature or corpse that explodes is instantly killed and is reduced to ashes.
On a successful saving throw, the target with 0 hitpoints loses one death saving throw (if applicable) and is otherwise unaffected.
This spell can only target corpses and automatically fails and is wasted if you target a construct, undead, or a living creature.

spell.name: Ghost Walk
entries: As an action, you or a willing creature can assume the ethereal presence of a phantom. For the duration, You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. Upon ending your turn in the space in another creature or object, your are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space. For every 5ft. you are shunted, you take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell of higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Necromantic Bolt
entries: You can fire a pulse of necrotic energy that causes a creature's body to begin to wither an decay. Make a ranged attack against a creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, that creature suffers vulnerability to the next damage roll against it until the end of your next turn as its body is corrupted by necrotic magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Soul Chain
entries: You can summon four ethereal souls to orbit around you. These souls can take the form of phantoms, skulls, or wisps, for the spell's duration.

When you cast a spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter, you can expend one of these souls to attack a creature you choose within 120ft. of you. Once the spirit reaches its target, that creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, it takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and is considered {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, it takes half damage and is not {@condition frightened}.
If one of these souls reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, you regain one expended soul for the duration of the spell as you temporarily bind the spirit of your foe to fight for you.

components.m: Small trinkets or heirlooms of a dead creature

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of souls you can conjure increases by 1.

spell.name: Undying Curse
entries: You can cast a necromantic soul curse on a creature within range. Until the spell ends, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. A Remove Curse cast on the target ends this spell early.

If a humanoid dies while under this curse, it returns to life as a skeleton or zombie at the start of its next turn. You can decide whether it is a zombie or a skeleton (the statistics for zombies and skeletons are in the Monster Manual).

You can use a bonus action to mentally command that undead with this spell. To receive the command, a creature must be within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the undead will take and where they will move during their next turn, or you can issue a general command.

If you issue no commands, the undead do nothing except defend themselves against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the undead continue to follow it until their task is complete. That creature under your control until the spell ends, after which they become inanimate once more.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours. At 9th level, you no linger have to maintain {@status concentration} on this spell and its duration lasts indefinitely or until you end it.

spell.name: Soul Burn
entries: You are able to assault the very soul of your target with a torrent of necrotic magic. Creatures in a 20ft. radius sphere must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage and half as much on a successful saving throw. If this spell reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, it is instantly killed.
This spell has no effect on constructs and undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the extra damage increases by one {@dice 1d8}

spell.name: Soul Storm
entries: You can conjure a gateway to the realm of the dead causing a vortex of swirling spirits to harass your foes. A 20ft. radius and 40ft. high cylinder appears, centered on a point within range, lasting for the duration of the spell. This vortex is filled with the wails and screams of hundreds of spirits that can be heard up to 100ft. away.

This vortex is considered to be difficult terrain and heavily obscures the vision of any creature in its area. Any creature that starts its turn in this area takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage. Any creature that ends its turn in this area must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. Creatures {@condition frightened} in this manner have their movement speed halved until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Withering Field
entries: You can generate a sphere of withering magic in a 30ft. radius around a spot you can see within range. Creatures that first enter this field or starts its turn within the cannot regain hitpoints until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Animate Ghoul
entries: You can imbue necromantic magic into a corpse of a creature of challenge rating 1 or lower that has died within the last month that is not an Construct, Plant, or Undead to raise it back to life as a zombie. After you finish casting your spell, the corpse returns to life as a zombified servant.

In its undead form, the target's game statistics remain the same except for the following: the creature can't use any features from Class features, Innate Spellcasting, Pact Magic, Spellcasting, abilities with a recharge, legendary actions or lair actions of its original form.

spell.name: Reaper's Scythe
entries: You can conjure a scythe of necromantic energy to create a reaping scythe. This magic weapon counts as a martial melee weapon which you are proficient. The scythe deals {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a hit and has the heavy and two handed property.
When you use this weapon to reduce a humanoid to 0 hitpoints, it instantly dies and returns to life as your choice of a zombie or skeleton at the start of your next turn.
You can decide whether it is a zombie or a skeleton (the statistics for zombies and skeletons are in the Monster Manual).

You can use a bonus action to mentally command these undead with this spell. To receive the command, the undead must be within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the undead will take and where they will move during their next turn, or you can issue a general command.

If you issue no commands, the undead do nothing except defend themselves against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the undead continue to follow it until their task is complete. That creature under your control until the spell ends, after which they become inanimate once more.
If you drop the weapon or throw it, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the scythe to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Visions from the Grave
entries: You are able to harness the last vestiges of life from a creature's soul to view it last moments of life through your own eyes. You can choose one corpse in range that that has not been dead no longer than a year. The spell fails if the corpse has been dead more than a year.

Until the spell ends, you are able to view and access any memories that the corpse may have had within the last hour of its death. You are able to see and hear as if you were using the target's senses during life. While in this state, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own senses.
While in this state, you can target specific memories that creature had based on any names, places, individuals, or other topics related to a specific memory .

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Level When you cast this spell at 7th level, this duration of accessed memories increases to 24 hours. When you use a 9th level spell slot, you can view any moment in the creatures life up to 1 year before its death.

spell.name: Desecration
entries: You touch a point and infuse an area with necromantic magics. The area can have a radius up to 60 feet and the spell fails if the radius includes an area already under the effect of the Desecration or Hallow spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects:

**Undying.** Dead bodies and corpses in the area cannot be revived or brought back to life by any means short of a Wish spell. After remaining in this area for one hour, dead bodies in this area return to life as a zombie or skeleton.

Undead raised in this manner are unfriendly to all living creatures. Roll initiative for the undead which has its own turns. It is under the Dungeon Master's control and acts according to its nature on each of its turns

**Cursed.** Creatures in this area cannot recover hitpoints. Whenever creatures take a short or long rest while in this area cannot use or regain hit die. Effects such as Lesser Restoration and Greater Restoration has no effect.

**Wither.** Affected creatures other than constructs and undead have their hitpoint maximum reduced by {@dice 2d10} while in this area. The damage can't reduce the target's hit points below 1. Once the creature leaves this area, its hit point returns to normal after 1 hour. A creature can only suffer from the effects of this casting of the spell once every day.
**Aura of Negativity.** Affected undead within this area gain {@dice 2d10} temporary hitpoints.
**Soul Siphon.** Creatures reduced to 0 hitpoint while in this area are instantly killed.

m.text: bones and blood worth at least 1000 gp which the spell consumes

spell.name: Animate Ghost
entries: You can imbue necromantic magic into a corpse of a creature of challenge rating 1 or lower that has died within the last day, that is not an Construct or Undead to raise it back to life as a ghost. After you finish casting your spell, the corpse returns to life as a spectral servant while its physical corpse still remains. In its undead form, the target's game statistics remain the same except for the following: The creature can't use any features from Class features, Innate Spellcasting, Pact Magic, Spellcasting, abilities with a recharge, legendary actions or lair actions of its original form.
在此法术持续期间，生物获得以下额外特征：(spell)
1.This creature's type is now Undead.
2.The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
3.When the ghost reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, that creature must succeed a Charisma saving throw equal to your spell save DC or be instantly killed
4.The ghost gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed.
5.It gains immunity to poison, necrotic, and nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
6.It gains immunity to being {@condition charmed}, exhausted, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained}, {@condition petrified}, or {@condition poisoned}
7.It gains resistance to cold, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from magical weapons
8.It no longer needs to breathe or eat

9.When it is reduced to 0 hitpoints, it can make a Constitution saving throw equal to half the damage dealt (minumum 10) to regain 1 hitpoint instead. It cannot benefit from this feature if it is turned or takes radiant damage on that turn.

The undead is friendly to you and your allies and acts on your initiative after your turn. It obeys your verbal commands as a bonus action as you mentally command any creature you made with this spell within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple undead, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any Command you've given it. To maintain the control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control on that creature.
Upon casting this spell on the same creature every day for one year, it becomes permanently under your control

m.text: A corpse of a creature which is consumed by the spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th Level or higher, the challenge rating of a creature that you can reanimate increases by 1.

spell.name: Death Chain
entries: A creature you can see within 150ft. become consumed with necromantic magic. You can force a creature you can see within range to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, that creature takes {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and half as much on a successful saving throw.

If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, you can choose to force another creature of your choice within range to make this saving throw. This creature takes {@damage 12d8} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw and half as much on a success. After this creature is targeted, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature before the spell ends, provided the prior target was reduced to 0 hitpoints. For each consecutive creature targeted, the damage die increases by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Plague Burst
entries: You unleash a bubbling orb of necrotic energy imbuing creatures in range with various necromantic sicknesses. Each creature in a 30ft. radius around a spot that you can see within range must roll a {@dice d6} to determine the effect:

1. Agony Creatures take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw and half as much on a success. If creatures are missing any hitpoints, the target takes {@damage 5d12} necrotic damage instead.

2. Withered Creatures take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and cannot recover hitpoints for one minute on a failed saving throw. Creatures can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect on a success. On a successful saving throw, creatures take half damage and are otherwise unaffected.

3. Disease Creatures take {@damage 5d8} poison damage and are {@condition poisoned} for one minute on a failed saving throw. Creatures can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect on a success. On a successful saving throw, creatures take half damage and are otherwise unaffected.

4. Decay Creatures take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage on failed saving throw and half as much on a success. On a failed saving throw, that creature suffers vulnerability to the next damage roll against it for the next minute.
5. Doom Creatures take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw and half as much on a success. If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, it is instantly killed.
6. Special The target suffers from two effects. Roll twice more rerolling any 6s.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the extra initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Souls
entries: You can create a wall of wailing souls that appears at a point you choose in range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. This wall can be free floating or it can rest on a solid surface.
The wall can be 60ft. long, 10ft. high, and 5ft. thick. The wall blocks line of sight through it.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area must succeed a Wisdom saving throw. on a failed saving throw, creatures take {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened} for one minute. Creatures {@condition frightened} in this manner have their movement speed halved for the duration as they are tormented by angry souls.

On a successful saving throw, it takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, end the effect on a success.

components.m: a skull of a creature that has died within the past day

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Duality Pulse
entries: You unleash of wave of both positive and negative energy that either ravages or replenishes the vitality of those in a 120 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. For each creature in range, you can choose to inflict one of the following effects.
1. An affected creature regains {@dice 8d8} hitpoints. This effect has no affect on undead an constructs.

2. An affected creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw. On a successful saving throw, creatures take half damage and are otherwise unaffected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8}

spell.name: Death Burst
entries: You are able to conjure a volatile orb of necrotic magic. Each creature in a 30ft. radius sphere centered on a spot within range must succeed a Constitution saving throw equal to your spell save DC.

On a failed saving throw, creatures take {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced for 1 hour by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took. Remove Curse or Greater Restoration allows a creature's hit point maximum to return to normal before that time passes.
On a successful saving thow, creatures take half damage and are otherwise unaffected.
If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints, it is instantly killed. This spell has no effect on constructs and undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the extra damage increases by one {@dice 2d6}

spell.name: Cripple
entries: You unleash a wave of necromantic energy that brutally cripples a creature you can see in range, shattering every bone in its body and rendering its muscles useless. The target takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creatures Strength and Dexterity scores become 1 and its movement speed is reduced to 0 . For the duration, the creature cannot use its action, bonus action, or reaction to make a weapon attack, use material components for spells, use or interact with objects, or even simple perform tasks.
At the end of 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.
The spell can also be ended by a greater restoration, heal, or wish.

components.m: a skeletal replica of a creature

spell.name: Negativity Pulse
entries: You can unleash a wave of necromantic energy that corrupting all living creatures in your wake binding their souls to your will upon their demise. All creatures within a 120ft. radius around you must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, creatures take {@damage 10d8 + 30} necrotic damage and half as much on a successful saving throw.

A humanoid creature killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as your choice of a skeleton or zombie that is permanently under your command, following your verbal orders to the best of its ability.

spell.name: Soul Beam
entries: You are able to focus the power of dying souls into a beam of necrotic energy that gets stronger which each creature slain. A creature in a 10ft. wide and 120ft. long line must succeed a Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, creatures take {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage. On a successful saving throw, creatures take half damage.

If this attack reduces any creature to 0 hitpoints on that turn, that creature is instantly killed and the base damage of this spell increases by {@dice 1d8}. This spell can only increase in this manner once on each of your turns.
Creatures killed in this manner cannot be revived by any means except for a Wish spell
You can use your action to create a new soul beam as your action on any turn until the spell ends.
